sportsCars.name: Ferrari LaFerrari
sportsCars.details: The LaFerrari is Ferrari's most ambitious project, featuring a hybrid engine that produces 950 horsepower, a top speed of over 217 mph, and a 0-60 mph time of under 2.5 seconds.

sportsCars.name: Lamborghini Aventador SVJ
sportsCars.details: The Aventador SVJ is a track-focused version of the Aventador, boasting a naturally aspirated V12 engine with 759 horsepower, active aerodynamics, and a record-setting NÃ¼rburgring lap time.

sportsCars.name: Porsche 911 GT3 RS
sportsCars.details: The 911 GT3 RS is the ultimate track-oriented version of the 911, equipped with a 4.0-liter flat-six engine producing 518 horsepower, advanced aerodynamics, and lightweight components.

sportsCars.name: McLaren 720S
sportsCars.details: The McLaren 720S features a twin-turbo V8 engine producing 710 horsepower, a lightweight carbon fiber chassis, and active aerodynamics for exceptional performance and handling.

sportsCars.name: Chevrolet Corvette C8
sportsCars.details: The C8 Corvette is the first mid-engine Corvette, featuring a 6.2-liter V8 engine with 495 horsepower, a top speed of 194 mph, and a striking new design.
